inlineContent.text: A parser attempts to parse a nebulous piece of data, represented by the
into something more well-structured, represented by the
, and its job is to turn this
if it cannot, which represents a parsing
because a parser will usually consume some of
the input in order to produce an output. For example, we can use the
extract an integer from the beginning of a
and consume that portion of the string:
It is best practice for a parser to
consume any of the input if it fails to produce an
output. This allows for “backtracking”, which means if a parser fails then another parser can

abstract.text: Declares a type that can parse an
value into an
value.
A parser that parses a sequence of elements from its input.
A parser that runs two parsers, one after the other, taking only the output of the first
parser.
A parser that consumes a subsequence from the beginning of its input up to a given sequence of
elements.
A parser that attempts to run another parser as many times as specified, accumulating the result
of the outputs.
A parser that consumes an integer (with an optional leading
or
sign) from the
beginning of a collection of UTF8 code units.
A parser that consumes an integer (with an optional leading
or
sign) from the
beginning of a substring using a UTF-8 parser.
Returns a parser that runs this parser, pipes its output into the given parser, and returns
the output of the given parser.
A parser that runs a parser of a tuple of outputs and another parser, one after the other,
and returns a flattened tuple of the first parser’s outputs and the second parser’s output.

of a downstream parser.

A parser that runs a parser of a tuple of outputs and another parser, one after the other,
and returns a flattened tuple of the first parser’s outputs and the second parser’s output.
A parser that consumes a subsequence from the beginning of its input.
Returns a parser that filters output from this parser when its output does not satisfy the
given predicate.
A parser that waits for a call to its
method before running the given closure to
create a parser for the given input.
A parser that runs two parsers, one after the other, and returns both outputs in a tuple.
A parser that filters the output of an upstream parser when it does not satisfy a predicate.
A parser that consumes a single newline from the beginning of the input. It will consume both
line feeds (
) and carriage returns with line feeds (
A parser that transforms the output of another parser with a given closure.
A parser that runs a parser of a tuple of outputs and another parser, one after the other,
and returns a flattened tuple of the first parser’s outputs and the second parser’s output.
A parser that can parse output from two types of parsers.
Attempts to parse a nebulous piece of data into something more well-structured.
Returns a parser that transforms the output of this parser with a given closure.
A parser that consumes a Boolean value from the beginning of a substring.

of a parser.

The kind of values parsed by this parser.
Transforms the receiver parser into one that can parse streams of input.
A parser that consumes all ASCII whitespace from the beginning of the input.
Returns a parser that discards the output of this parser by returning
instead.
Returns a parser that runs this parser and the given parser, returning this parser’s outputs
and the given parser’s output in a flattened tuple.
A parser that consumes the first element from a collection. Fails on an empty collection.
A parser that runs two parsers, one after the other, taking only the output of the second
parser.
A parser that always succeeds by returning the provided value, but does not consume any of its
input.
Returns a parser that runs this parser and the given parser, returning this parser’s outputs
and the given parser’s output in a flattened tuple.
A parser that consumes a subsequence from the beginning of its input through a given sequence of
elements.
The kind of values this parser receives.
A parser that consumes everything to the end of the collection and returns it as its output.
A parser that always fails, no matter the input.

results of calling the given closure with the

Returns a parser that runs this parser and the given parser, returning this parser’s outputs

A parser that consumes a Boolean value from the beginning of a collection of UTF-8 code units.

A parser that outputs the non-
results of calling the given transformation with the

Returns a parser that runs this parser and the given parser, returning both outputs in a

Returns a parser that runs this parser and the given parser, taking only the output of this
